'''Jill Pike''' (born July 13, 1980) is a radio personality and political commentator, and is formerly one of the hosts of the [[talk radio]] show ''[[The Young Turks (talk show)|The Young Turks]]'' on [[Air America Radio]]<ref name="BUS">{{cite news |title= The Right Stuff from a Lefty Trio |url= http://www.businessweek.com/bwdaily/dnflash/feb2006/nf2006027_4397_db011.htm |first= Ronald |last=Grover| February 7, 2006 |work= Business Week |accessdate= 2006-10-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=The Young Turks' Deliver Political Punditry On-line |url= http://www.voanews.com/english/archive/2006-04/2006-04-13-voa55.cfm?CFID=47877510&CFTOKEN=43253255l |publisher= Voice of America | first= Maura Jane |last= Farrelly |date= April 3 2006 |accessdate= 2006-10-16}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>. Pike occasionally substitute hosted The Young Turks when either [[Cenk Uygur]] or [[Ben Mankiewicz]] was absent. Jill was also the former co-host of an internet-only broadcast following the show entitled ''Absolute Truth''. She is an outspoken atheist. <ref>{{cite web|author=26 april 2007 |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RsR72LuZFrE&feature=channel_page |title=Abortion |publisher=YouTube |date=2007-04-26 |accessdate=2010-01-01}}</ref> Pike has also been a political opinion contributor to [[ABC News]]. <ref name="ABCNews">{{cite news |title= Getting Beyond the Drama of Immigration Reform |url= http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/story?id=2658451&page=1 |first= Jill |last= Pike| November 16, 2006 |work=ABC News|accessdate= 2006-11-26}}</ref><ref name="ABCNews2">{{cite news |title=The Issue Here Is That Dirty Little Word: 'Sex.' | url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/BothSidesAllSides/story?id=2853140&page=1 |work=[[ABC News]] |first=Jill| last=Pike |date= February 6, 2007 }} </ref> She is currently the Deputy Director for Public Affairs at Third Way <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thirdway.org/internships |title=About Us - Internships |publisher=Third Way |date= |accessdate=2010-01-01}}</ref>.
'''Jill Pike''' (born July 13, 1980) is a radio personality and political commentator, and is formerly one of the hosts of the [[talk radio]] show ''[[The Young Turks (talk show)|The Young Turks]]'' on [[Air America Radio]]<ref name="BUS">{{cite news |title= The Right Stuff from a Lefty Trio |url= http://www.businessweek.com/bwdaily/dnflash/feb2006/nf2006027_4397_db011.htm |first= Ronald |last=Grover| February 7, 2006 |work= Business Week |accessdate= 2006-10-16}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=The Young Turks' Deliver Political Punditry On-line |url= http://www.voanews.com/english/archive/2006-04/2006-04-13-voa55.cfm?CFID=47877510&CFTOKEN=43253255l |publisher= Voice of America | first= Maura Jane |last= Farrelly |date= April 3 2006 |accessdate= 2006-10-16}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>. Pike occasionally substitute hosted The Young Turks when either [[Cenk Uygur]] or [[Ben Mankiewicz]] was absent. Jill was also the former co-host of an internet-only broadcast following the show entitled ''Absolute Truth''. She is an outspoken atheist. <ref>{{cite web|author=26 april 2007 |url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RsR72LuZFrE&feature=channel_page |title=Abortion |publisher=YouTube |date=2007-04-26 |accessdate=2010-01-01}}</ref> Pike has also been a political opinion contributor to [[ABC News]]. <ref name="ABCNews">{{cite news |title= Getting Beyond the Drama of Immigration Reform |url= http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/story?id=2658451&page=1 |first= Jill |last= Pike| November 16, 2006 |work=ABC News|accessdate= 2006-11-26}}</ref><ref name="ABCNews2">{{cite news |title=The Issue Here Is That Dirty Little Word: 'Sex.' | url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/BothSidesAllSides/story?id=2853140&page=1 |work=[[ABC News]] |first=Jill| last=Pike |date= February 6, 2007 }} </ref> She is currently the Deputy Director for Public Affairs at Third Way <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thirdway.org/internships |title=About Us - Internships |publisher=Third Way |date= |accessdate=2010-01-01}}</ref>.
